title: Where Rainbows Never Die
features: Dr. Beck befriends nine-year-old cancer patient, Emily, and her guardian, Tiffany. Out of options for further chemotherapy, her only shot at survival is a costly experimental medication. In an attempt to gather the funds, the three set out on an epic adventure to seek a hidden treasure as they try to save Emily’s life. Along the way, Dr. Beck faces his own inner demons with help from his traveling companions and the three grow even closer.One of the artifacts contained in the treasure chest is an ancient Incan bracelet with magical powers, and a parallel story details the fates of two young Incans and their forbidden love.
description: Do yourself a favor and purchase this book! I couldn't put it down and read it in one sitting. It is a captivating and creative story of past and present with beautifully intertwined story lines. It's so well written and easy to read while still keeping you intrigued as to how everything will play out. Loved it!!
Once I started reading the book I couldn't put it down. This book has it all....humor, adventure, excitement, love and loss. I'm looking forward to his second book already.
Past, present, and hope for the future are beautifully woven together in this book. I was so engaged that I literally did not put it down from start to finish!
A quick read full of adventure, hope, and love. Highly recommend!
When you can't seem to find a good stopping point, it must be a good book.

I read this book simply to enjoy the written word. It was a compelling story woven into the experiences of a dedicated hospitalist and his love of history. His descriptions of a day in the life of a doctor, the history of the Incas, and his care for a victim of childhood cancer set the stage for the adventures in a search for hidden treasure.

﻿Wouldn't it be a better place if there were more Doctors like Dr Beck. This book makes you laugh and cry, holds your attention till the very end. I can't believe this is a first time author, congratulations Dr Deweese well done.

Author Ryan Deweese is a physician with over twenty years of experience in the medical field and a first-time author. He lives in Indiana with his wife and two children, where he continues to practice hospital-based medicine. His hobbies include reading, writing, and golf. He describes his first book as a wild ride through his imagination full of comedy, tragedy, and hope.Cancer is a terrible thing, and half of the money raised from the sale of this book are going toward pediatric cancer research through the Caroline Symmes Children's Cancer Endowment and Riley Children's Hospital. You can visit the website to learn more at: carolinesymmes.org
